title: How to Make Watercress Soup

steps.headline: Preparing the vegetables.
steps.description: Chop the leek whites and wash. Peel and chop the potatoes into small cubes and chop the watercress.

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a large deep saucepan.
Add the prepared leeks potato and watercress and stir until fully coated in the melted butter.
Add some salt and cover the pan with a lid so the vegetables can sweat on a gentle heat for around 20 minutes.
Add 3 pints of stock.
steps.description: Bring everything up to simmering point. Cover for a further 10-15 minutes or until the vegetables are soft.

steps.headline: Liquidise, then pour the soup back into the pan.
Add three tablespoons of Crème fraiche, and season to taste.
Serve in pre-warmed soup bowls and top each one with a little swirl of Crème fraiche and a few watercress leaves.

text: Preparing the vegetables. Chop the leek whites and wash. Peel and chop the potatoes into small cubes and chop the watercress. Melt the butter in a large deep saucepan.  Add the prepared leeks potato and watercress and stir until fully coated in the melted butter.  Add some salt and cover the pan with a lid so the vegetables can sweat on a gentle heat for around 20 minutes. Stir halfway through. Add 3 pints of stock. Bring everything up to simmering point. Cover for a further 10-15 minutes or until the vegetables are soft. Remove from the heat. Allow the soup to cool. Liquidise, then pour the soup back into the pan.  Add three tablespoons of Crème fraiche, and season to taste.  Very gently reheat the soup.  Serve in pre-warmed soup bowls and top each one with a little swirl of Crème fraiche and a few watercress leaves.  Finished.
